column1: 23$Bipolar Depression$8/23/2016 5:27:36 PM$Reviewer: I feel good
column2: 45-54 on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $3$1$3$Started taking 200mg along with Lamectal. Within 20 minutes I was so tired I could hardly talk. I no longer had high/low but I felt like a zombie-no emotions at all
column3: always tired and dragging
column4: no desire to do anything. Decreased to 100mg and felt emotionally better but still had a hard time completing tasks. Here it is 7 years later with a new doctor. After learning more about the side effects I decided I had had enough. We made a plan to get off quetiapine- SLOWLY to prevent a manic/depressive episode. It took 6 months and I am totally off it. I had to retrain myself to fall asleep drug-free but I did it. I feel 100% better! My head's not foggy
column5: I have energy
column6: projects are actually getting completed. This does not feel like the manic highs I've experienced before. I just feel good. Like a new lease on life. Do your research and talk with your doctor before taking this drug.

138$Bipolar Depression$1/11/2008 11:41:57 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$Previously I had been treated with very limited success with: Lithium, Depacote, Triliptal, Risperdal, Lamictal, zoloft, Wellbutrin, Abilify, clonsepam, zypreza etc.  My exsistance was unbearable.  I went to a clinic and was taken off all the above.  I spent three weeks rapid cycling with psychotic features and devestating depressions and suicidality.  Within a week of starting Seroquel  my symptoms disappeared and have not returned in two years.  The possible side effects are frightening but nothing compares with the hell I lived with for nearly 20 years

160$Bipolar Depression$3/28/2019 6:44:04 PM$Reviewer: Bluntlady, 19-24 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$I was prescribed 100mg seroquel by my psychiatrist about a month ago. Make sure you read all possible side effects because there are a lot and some are pretty serious! I cut my dose in half to 50mg because 100mg was way too strong. I have to take it no later than 11pm or i am exhausted the whole next day. So far I have had no side effects from the drug. I take it in combination with Lamictal 300mg and lexapro 20mg in the morning and xanax as needed. This medication has worked great for me. It helps me sleep well and I am noticably more calm. I haven't had to take my xanax nearly as much. It has lowered my anxiety and i have had no severe mood swings or huge breakdowns since i have started it. I have had no weight gain or change in appetite. It is important you have blood work done regularly as it can change cholesterol levels and white blood cell count.

column2: talking proper sentences and hand eye coordination became difficult. I became so scared. I didn't feel pain or happiness. I was completely numb like a robot. Sleeping days at a time. Forgetting shifts at work falling asleep everywhere I sat down. I had to get off I feared it was going to kill me.

column1: I tapered to 50mg then 25mg over about 2 months. I'm completely off now for about 3-4 weeks. Instantly my memory became clearer. Side effects at the beginning were extreme irratibility

column6: insomnia
column7: very sensitive to light and I feel like I'm losing touch with reality. Hard to explain although worst experience of my life. This drug should ONLY be prescribed for extreme life or death cases. Or banned. It's disgusting. DO NOT RECOMMEND.  "

column1: 210$Bipolar Depression$5/25/2016 9:48:08 PM$Reviewer: QuestionPrescripDrugs
column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $2$1$5$I have been off this medication for years now. But I used it for 2.5 years from ages 15-17. It was horrible
column3: but I was also misdiagnosed with Bipolar. It made me tired
column4: cranky
column5: nauseous and unable to eat for a month at a time
column6: gave me headaches
column7: and made me dizzy. There were plenty of times when I consumed huge amounts of alcohol and pot with Seroquel
column8: which was never a good experience. Don't ever do it! Please. I was originally put on 400 mg and they upped it to 800mg gradually
column9: (when you're first put on the drug
column10: you feel drunk for about a week).I finally had enough and stopped using it cold turkey. I had physical withdrawal for three months - similar to a heroin withdrawal (from what I've read in relation to my symptoms). The drug increased my heart rate astronomically - I was seeing stars quite a bit. It made me crave unhealthy foods which didn't help
column11: and made me gain unhealthy weight. Before you go on this drug
column12: seriously contemplate whether you actually need it. And NEVER mix it with another substance. As a healthcare worker
column13: I would NEVER put a teenager on this drug
column14: unless they had severe schizophrenic symptoms. I started to develop facial twitches after awhile and slurred speech. It took a couple years and major lifestyle changes until all of these effects completely dissipated. The only thing I appreciated about Seroquel was its ability to put me to sleep
column16: as I have a hard time staying asleep throughout the night. However
column17: it caused me to have many bouts of sleep paralysis.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $2$1$5$"Based on all the reviews I read prior to taking it and the initial warning from my doctor about potential grogginess I can say Seroquel had the complete opposite side effect on me. column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$5$Well I have to disagee with the people who say oh do not take this drug it is deadly come on what is bad for one person doesn't necacarily mean it is bad for another! The only problem I have had with seroquel is I talk in my sleep and I do it every night my daughter told me so she is 21 and I never beleived her so she videoed me haha Now I believe her for sure! It is funny to me but keeps her up at night! I mumble and talk and say weird stuff never before did i ever do this but one other problem is weight gain but the medicine isn't making me gain weight it is the food i tend to blame it on the seroquel i dont get enough excercize and i love sweets well of course i am gonna gain weight but i definetly sleep my eight hours when i wake up i feel great not tired but some people say they feel tired after taking this drug but not everybody can take this drug and feel wonderful like me it has helped my bipolar it feels like it is totally gone i hardly ever ever get depressed anymore and before that i cried every other freakin day for no reason at all it was so horrible being in my skin i hated it . If i were to stop this drug or some moron convinced the drug company to stop making it because they think it is so deadly for everyone just cause it did not work FOR THEM I would literally end up in a mental institution! I NEED MY SEROQUEL UNLIKE some people that want everyone to stop taking it ! U should know better once u take this medication you are supposed to lay down and go to bed not go steal milk at the store! Anyhow this really is a terific drug and i hope they never ever get rid of it god bless u all that r on it!

column1: 244$Bipolar Depression$6/11/2015 7:25:06 PM$Reviewer: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$4$4$"I've been on this for 5 years-600mg. Like others say

column3: it has been almost four years since my last inpatient treatment and I can live with that. I've gotten used to the side affects which for me are mostly the comatose feeling. column1: 250$Bipolar Depression$5/15/2015 6:58:41 AM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$4$4$I have been taking only 50 mg of Seroquel  a night for sleep and that puts me out.  I see a lot of people talking about 200 mg plus
column2: I can't imagine that.  This medicine along with effexor has worked for my depression but I'm trying to get off of them since I have the worst side effects with weight gain and short term memory loss.  I literally feel like I've smoked a joint every time I take this pill.  For mood swings

column4: but I feel like a healthy life style is what has been best for me in the past.  Healthy eating and exercise can work miracles.  When I was drinking and partying and not working a lot it was depressing and that made me lose it a little.  So I have been on this med since 2009 bbut I have also still struggled with sobriety completely.

column1: 255$Bipolar Depression$4/24/2015 11:39:56 AM$Reviewer: ran10
column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$"After trying many different drugs and combinations of drugs prescribed by a psychiatrist to treat my Bipolar Depression with little success
column3: my family doctor suggested I try Seroquel.

column1:
272$Bipolar Depression$1/8/2015 7:38:52 PM$Reviewer: ThinkingMonkey, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$5$5$I was prescribed 300mg of Seroquel several years ago by my psychiatrist for schizophrenia and bipolar disorder. I was also taking about 8 others. Didn't help much and as many of you may have experienced with it, I had a massive weight gain and slept like 20 hours a day. I normally weigh around 200 but was at 260 after about 2 1/2 months(!). I told her I wasn't taking it anymore, it wasn't helping and it had those very severe eating and sleeping side effects. Well, fast forward about 6 years and 2 psychiatrist later and now the new doctor decides Seroquel is a really good idea, 900mg at that, triple what had messed me up so bad earlier. I told her I wasn't taking it but she insisted I at least try it. Lo and behold I felt like a new man and I had no sleeping or eating side effects whatsoever! I couldn't believe it. So I've been taking that dosage for about 3 years now and it works pretty well. The combination of medicine I now take, quite a bit of it, does seem to hinge on my 3mg daily of Ativan though. If I miss a couple of doses it seems to throw EVERYTHING out of whack. None of the other medications seem to work right anymore. So I guess this review is pretty worthless because what I'm saying from personal experience is that Seroquel is horrible and you gain 30 pounds a month and sleep all day and night, but later experience with it proved to work pretty darn good. I would say 'great' but I don't think any medication works 'great', except for Nexium, that is. :)

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$5$"I've only been on Seroquel for about 4 months.  I take 200 mg before bed and sleep pretty well. At first
column3: I did have some vivid and anxious dreams but that tapered off after time.  If I still have trouble staying asleep I can take .5 mg Xanax and the combination usually puts me in a restful sleep.  No hangover effect for me.  No ill effects at all
column4: really.  I also take 200 mg Lamictal along with 150 mg Wellbutrin  and most days about .5 mg of Adderall in the morning.  Then another 100 Lamictal at night.  After decades of ""spinning the wheel of antidepressants""
column5: this combo finally has yielded a very positive result.  No more highs and lows.  A great deal more focus
column6: energy
column7: concentration and drive.  Helped me end my love affair with alcohol too...no serious anxiety or worries to hide from. Everything seems a lot less complicated and easier to deal with.  It's not that my life is without problems
column8: it's just a lot easier to assess
column9: address
column10: and handle things.  I have actually lost weight probably due to the Adderall.  As far as my dosage
column11: I could keep adjusting up or down on any of these
column12: but I'm pretty happy with what I've got going now...don't want to upset the apple cart here. Best I've felt since I was a kid
column13: it's about time.  I hope it lasts!"

column1: 424$Bipolar Depression$5/19/2013 10:23:11 PM$Reviewer: DeplinEvangelist
column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $1$1$1$"For me
column3: this med was a disaster.  It was prescribed for me initially by a pill pushing shrink who made a snap judgement that I was bipolar II after my wife filed for divorce and I asked for help.  I had been on and off anti-depressants for years
column4: usually after failed relationships.  It made things worse
column5: not better
column6: and I ended up in and out of the psych ward six times over the next three years
column7: and each time they increased the dose
column8: finally to  a staggering 900 mg per day
column9: also prescribing high doses of Lamictal
column10: Abilify
column11: Effexor and Clonazepam
column12: at  which point I became a zombie and was unable to function for nearly two years.  I also gained the standard 80 lbs.  I'm my experience this drug and the others represent all that is wrong with ""modern"" psychiatry; blindly throwing questionable meds at the problem without an understanding of the underlying brain chemistry.  My salvation from this nightmare came when I got fed up and started seeing a psychiatrist who had the reputation as being one of the best in the business in a large West Coast city.  She carefully listened to my symptoms
column13: my story
column14: and after a few sessions had me tested for the MTHFR genetic mutation
column15: which occurs in various forms in approximately 10% of the population.  Turns out I had two of the mutations which keep the body from processing folic acid
column16: a common vitamin found in many foods
column18: which is needed to balance the common mood regulators
column21: which I am sure many of you know about if you are on this website.  Her solution was to put me on Deplin
column22: a medicinal food ( not a drug!) and wean me off Seroquel and the other drugs
column23: which she felt were either totally useless or in the case of Seroquel did more harm than good.  Within a month I started feeling much better and after four months I was weaned off all of the meds
column24: completely symptom free  This is my story only
column25: but beware Astra Zeneca and the pill pushing incompetent shrinks."

column1: 457$Bipolar Depression$1/28/2013 9:05:04 AM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $1$1$1$I took Seroquel for 9 months & I HATED it.  I worked up to 300mg.  I took the medication at night & it would knock me out for 10 – 12 hours straight.  I gave it a couple months to see if the side effects would lessen.  They didn’t.  So we cut my dosage in half down to 150mg.  I still slept a lot & I could not get moving the next day.  I kept taking the meds thinking things would level out over the next few months.  They didn’t.  The medication did not help my depression at all & on top of that my body felt so drugged.  I was so weak that I could barely take care of every day household chores.  I almost never left my house because I always felt so bad both emotionally & physically.  We cut my dosage down again & a couple months later I still felt horrible.  I WAS A PRISONER IN MY OWN BODY!!  I read that other people gained weight on this medication.  I actually LOST weight.  I have always been thin but while on this medication I started to look like a walking skeleton.  I live alone & I was too weak & tried to even get up to cook.  I was only eating one small meal a day.  It was quite scary watching myself literally withering away.  I finally asked my doctor to get me off Seroquel.  She prescribed Citalopram (generic for Lexapro) and after just two weeks I am starting to feel better & I am eating better also.  I regret wasting almost a year of my life on Seroquel.  I should have gotten off of it sooner.  Live & learn.

I felt innebriated and out of focus. I did not feel safe to drive. I had distinct memory loss and my temper was shorter than normal. And the mood swings were not resolved at all. I stopped taking seroquel and switched to Prozac to address the moodswings. My OBGYN is quite sure I was misdiagnosed and suffer from PMDD as opossed to bipolar II. I have been taking Prozac for 2 months and feel like I have my life back. Another note worth mentioning is that I've never had a weight problem, and at age 40 have been 125-132 since age 20. Within a month of taking seroquel I had gained 15 pounds. It was a very strange experience. Be advised that seroquel is a very serious, mind-altering drug. It felt very dangerous and unnecessary for me, but again, perhaps it was due to a misdiagnosis.

584$Bipolar Depression$3/9/2012 5:50:54 PM$Reviewer: Illmissbacchus, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$4$I was prescribed Seroquel and took it for only 4 days total. It started a manic episode that literally had me smashing my head against the wall at work.  One co-worker found me lying unresponsive on the couch and thought I was dead, really I was just out-of-my-mind with panic, rage, and silent screams only I could hear.  I decided to take myself off it after that, as rogue librarians are frowned upon.  However, and I don't have any proof that this was a side effect of Seroquel and I'm sure people would argue with me but, for eight months afterwards and very seldom, to a far lesser extend, now I experienced pain in my shoulders and spine as if my skeleton were attempting to escape my body through the base of my neck. column1: 731$Bipolar Depression$8/24/2011 11:12:08 AM$Reviewer: Crash85
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$When I was first diagnosed as Bi-Polar approx. 10 years ago
column3: I was put on an SSRI. The SSRI had bad side effects
column4: and I stopped taking. I have tried several different SSRI Anti-Depressants during this 10 year span. Approx. 3 years ago I ended up in a Mental Health Facility
column5: and while in there I saw a psychiatrist. After an assessment the Doctor again diagnosed me as Bi-polar with an added diagnosis of Severe Anxiety w/Panic Attacks
column6: and again tried another SSRI that was fairly new to me at the time called Celexa. I took it for about a month or so until the same side effects I have always had with SSRIs began. So I went to my new doctor and explained this to him. He then prescribed me Seroquel to try as an alternative to an SSRI
column7: at first at a low dosage
column8: than higher as I needed it. Not only did it NOT cause the same unwanted side effects as the SSRIs did
column9: it eased my conditions very well and proved to be extremely effective. It has successfully countered my Bi-Polar Disorder for the last 3 or so years. It also aides with the Severe Anxiety & Panic Attacks (along with Clonazepam). Lastly
column10: I have also been diagnosed as an Insomniac and again Seroquel alone has also conquered that diagnosis as well. All in all
column11: while this medicine is expensive due to the lack of generics (patent hasn't expired) it is well worth the money as I have had multiple disabling problems managed with the use of this one drug. The price of the medication can be adjusted with insurance
column12: and/or a financial plan with the Drug Company themselves who offer RX Discounts
column13: and free medication to those who are in need. The only bad side effects I have experienced with this medication is occasional nightmares
column14: and dry mouth in the morning. I hope this helps anyone thinking of taking this medication. For my situation it was a PERFECT solution
column15: and it may be the answer for you as well. Always talk to your doctor and weigh the pros and cons.

column1: 769$Bipolar Depression$6/29/2011 4:56:49 AM$Reviewer: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $2$1$4$Seroquel was expensive and no fun at all.  After taking my dose
column2: I would be in between sleep and wakefulness.  I would not be able to sleep
column3: but would be very drowsy and yet restless.  It was a very uncomfortable feeling.  I would lie down and not be able to get comfortable.  The uncomfortable feeling occurred whether I took Seroquel in the morning or at night.  I kept taking it anyway.  I can't say how much it helped and how much was the natural course of my bipolar disorder.  But I would not take it again if I had the choice (and fortunately nobody's asking me to.)  Maybe it will work for you
column4: but not for me.  I haven't taken it in years.  Now I'm on a generic version of Lamictal and a generic version of Risperdal.  Risperdal used to have a similar effect on me
column5: but it doesn't anymore.  Maybe it was my drinking that caused the unpleasant side effects.  Who knows why these drugs work this way?  I sure don't.  But I'm much better without drinking.  I recommend it (quitting drinking).

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $2$1$3$"Seroquel lowered my blood pressure so much I had to stay in the hospital 8 days.  My blood pressure hovered around 60 over 40.  I kept losing my vision
column3: falling down
column4: heard buzzing or ringing sounds
column5: slurred my speach.

column1: It was terrifying.
I had taken seroquel for a couple of years before having the acute adverse reaction.
I also became so sleepy I would sleep for two or three days at a time.

When I finally stopped taking it I lost 35lbs.  I believe that the medication has very long term effects on my brain.  I haven't taken it in three months now and I still feel foggier and more stupid than I used to be.
My memory seems to be permanently changed.  I cannot remember as well as I used to before taking this drug.
Physicians are prescribing it to large numbers of patients now.  I think there will be a large population of people who are less intelligent than they were prior to taking the drug.
Also
column2: there is no cure for hypotension.  So
column3: if you get it like I did
column4: you are just plain screwed.  Spend time considering these side effects.  I think they may be permanent.

1216$Bipolar Depression$3/19/2010 3:29:28 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $3$2$4$I started taking Seroquel for my bipolar disorder several years ago at first it worked well helping me get much needed sleep. I did have a hard time being alert on it. My dose gradually increased over time and added lamictal to it. I was taking 200mg  in the morning 200 in the afternoon and 400 at bed time. This medication worked very well however the side effects were not worth it all it made me gain weight but the problem came when I had my blood drawn and we were able to see what was going on inside  this medication raised my cholesterol messed up my sugar and my thyroid. The only good news I have after being off it for a year everything is almost back to normal. If you are taking this medication you should have blood work done on a regular basis

column3: but after a while the side effects began to greatly outweigh the positives.  It was great for putting me to sleep
column4: and though I didn't have too much trouble waking up

column6: which obviously made all activities difficult/dangerous.  I also experienced auditory hallucinations
column7: though not intense or alarming.  I truly only noticed them once they were absent after stopping the medication.  The withdrawl was horrible.  I was constantly sick to my stomach
column8: could barely eat
column9: and vomited for over a month.  However
column10: it was worth it!  I still experience mild hypomanic episodes
column11: but not as serious previous to the Seroquel.  I still remain on the Lamictal and it has been a savior.

column7: this drug was very difficult to use.  Having to take it pretty much as soon as I got home
column8: to make sure that I would get enough sleep to hear the alarm in the morning.  I needed to have at least 12 hours of sleep.  It's just not possible to spend time with my husband and take care of my child on this medication.

column1: At this point

I have been on this medication for 4 months at 300mg.  The first 2 weeks of taking this medication were a blur.  I remember being in a daze, disoriented, dizzy, and very very tired.  Ok, I gave it a few months.  The verdict, I am not impressed with its powers as a depression fighting drug.  On the other hand, I do suffer from sleep apnea and insomnia and it actually helps me fall asleep.  I take it 2 hour before bedtime, and by bedtime I am about to fall over, boy does it make you sedated, but I am no longer tossing and turning for hours before finally falling asleep.  It takes me about 15 to 20 minutes and I am out!  A good sedative for sleeping but not so much a good mood-stabilizer/anti-depressant.

column1: 1508$Bipolar Depression$8/11/2009 3:50:05 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $2$1$3$I've tried a lot of antidepressants over the past few years. All the drugs I've tried either didn't work or worked for a bit before they stopped working. Last week
column2: I went to my doctor to follow-up on the Pristiq I've been taking. I told her that some days it seems to help
column3: but other days it seems like I haven't been taking anything.  I also told her that a month or so ago
column4: I was feeling good so I stopped taking it for about 2 weeks and felt great before I crashed. She said it could be that the drug worked its way out of my system
column5: or it could be that I may be bipolar.  I told her that my therapist has had me tracking my moods
column6: and she thinks I may be hypomanic.  My doctor said most people call the doctor when they are feeling down and think they're depressed
column7: so a lot of the time
column8: bipolar disorder gets overlooked.  She had me fill out a questionnaire
column9: and the results showed borderline bipolar disorder. She suggested trying Seroquel. She gave me a starter pack which starts at 50mg on the first day
column10: increases to 100mg on the second day
column11: and goes up to 200mg on the third day.  My doctor said to take the Seroquel at night because it WILL make me drowsy.  I took my first dose (50mg) on Saturday night and woke up on Sunday in a major daze. My husband kept asking me if I was ok. By late afternoon/early evening
column12: I wasn't in a daze anymore. I took my second dose that night (100mg) and woke up on Monday morning again in a daze. I took the morning off work because I was afraid to drive. It almost felt like I had been drinking. That night I took the third dose (200mg). I woke up today feeling very dazed
column13: although I'm coming out of it now around 3:30. I stayed home from work today and called my doctor to see if this was a normal side effect and to ask whether it'll go away. They called me back and said the doctor is calling in a rx for Abilify instead. I hope that helps. The Seroquel has helped with my racing thoughts
column14: but I don't think the daze I've been in is worth it.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$1$5$"This medication worked for me only in treating bipolar. I had terrible side effects. First i gained 40pds. Then i was a zombie the next day and i am a 32 yr old woman with three children. It also raised my triglycerides alot. Normal is under 150 and mine was 609. High triglycerides can cause damage to your pancreatitis and can kill you. I am having a hard time remembering things and i have problems getting my sentences straight. But the worest of it all is i was diagnost with Tardive Dyskinsia which is terrible i now have movements with my mouth and tongue that i can't control. If you look up the side effects on this drug they say its suposely rare to get Tardive Dyskinsia well i guess i was that one in a millon. This drug is terrible i don't reccomend seroquel to anyone. Now on top of taking my normal biplor meds i have to take Niacin for my Triglycerides and 200 iu of vitamin e complex to help control Tardive dyskinsia. My dr told me that Tardive Dyskinsia is sometimes irriversable. Which means i will probaly have to live with it. I would not reccomend seroquel to my worest enemy. Now my dr has slowly taken me off the Serquel and put me on Geodon. Wonderful drug it gives me lots of get up and go and a different out look on life. It opens up your eyes. The only side effect with Geodon is at first its kinda like Seroquel when you get up in the morning its hard to get up an go but my dr gave me Adderall 10mg to take in the morning and i now have know problems. So to all you people out there with Bipolar with panic attacks and aniety DONT TAKE SEROQUEL IT HAS RUINED MY LIFE!!!!

1704$Bipolar Depression$4/4/2009 6:23:13 PM$Reviewer: bwise, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $2$1$1$seroquel is a very mysterious drug. having been on it for years it seemed to calm many over acting thoughts. of course there is the weight gain but that did not effect my view on this med. i weened off sucessfully, but then put back on for reasons unknown. thats when i realized the outstanding unacceptable side effects. 200mg pill sent me into a nightmare of out of control physical behavior. spasms, jaunting muscles, seizure type episodes, than hospitalization. i decided to look into this med, and discovered the negative side effects highly outstand the possitive in many case studies. this med is at the end of its patent, and is being pushed to patients in high measures. costly, it needs to sell before generics are able to replace it. seroquel barely passed fda regs and i know why. diabeties,extreme weight gain, dillusinal behavior. the sedation aspect as many complain about pales in comparison to how mind altering this drug can be in many,many patients. im underwhelmed, to say the least, this med is rxed to sooooo many. start with very low doseage, and do research. a good alternative is thorzine. it may be oldschool, but its been around so long for a reason. i worry seroquel is pushed too hard on every diagnoses ones dr invents. meds are hugely profitable to many players in this field. by the way, as many know, the makers of seroquel are and have been sued with numerous cases pending. god bless if it works but if you suffer its evil do not be talked into a abusive relationship with this med. long term effects may insue. p.s. sorry for the poor spelling. that i wont blame on seroquel.

1729$Bipolar Depression$3/17/2009 3:29:00 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $3$1$2$I'm now 21 years old. When I was 15 I attempted suicide for the first time, I was sent to a mental facility where they diagnosed me for Bipolar and put me on Seroquel and Lithium. I gained a lot of weight off from the Seroquel, and it messed with my head a lot. After I took it I felt extremely lethargic and sleepy. I didn't sleep well, I'd often scream in my sleep and wake myself and everyone around me. The drug made me more confused than anything else, I didn't feel as sad as I did before, but I also couldn't feel happy (unless I was over tired from taking it), it was like I was numb. Nine months later I had a second suicide attempt, I was sent to a different mental health hospital and they replaced my medications with Lexapro, Wellbutrin and Topamax (mostly to help my weight situation). I just got off all my medications last spring, so it's been almost a year now that I've been medication and therapy free. Althought Seroquel can actually treat people, I don't really recommend it for most.

I love that it helps me sleep, and my mood has been pretty good.  I've recently developed some really weird side effects though - some nights when I go to bed my heart pounds so fast and hard I'm afraid I'm going to have a heart attack, and I've started having irrational fears and panic after taking it at night.  I'm a perfectly normal professional during the day, but after taking Seroquel at night I'm convinced evil spirits or ghosts are going to get me, and have to sleep with a nightlight on with all the doors in the bedroom closed and locked!  Not a lot of fun!! I'm waiting to get in with the doc and have started tapering off.

column1: I honestly don’t recommend this to anyone due to the ineffectiveness of the product and because it will make you feel like a zombie for at least 99% of your day.  Before I took this medication I actually felt better so I am now at the point of lowering my own dose by cutting my pills in half each day and eventually I will stop taking this medication and seek out a naturopathic or holistic route.
I feel that doctors today will prescribe medications to patients without being totally honest about what other products are out there
column2: so we must do our own research.  I have come to the conclusion that doing your own research and finding a doctor who wholeheartedly cares about your well being and is interested and/or willing to try alternatives before giving meds that will make your life “less productive” can make the difference in solving the problem or having a medical condition that can affect you for the rest of your life.

column1: 2605$Bipolar Depression$8/22/2015 3:16:32 AM$Reviewer: goosegirl
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $3$2$4$Here is the thing about Seroquel XR
column3: by the time I started taking it I was so desperate for sleep and some relief from my depression
column4: I didn't care what it did to me. Five years later
column5: my dosage doesn't work to help me sleep but twelve hours later I still can't get out of bed. It makes me feel DEPRESSED! I am so unmotivated to do anything and yes I get the late night munchies even though I'm almost falling down the stairs to get food because I'm groggy. I'm determined to wean myself off this drug. I think its good for a short term
column6: but not long term. I tried cold turkey and I felt like I was dying for well over a month. I went back to half a dose. Sometimes if I haven't slept I take a whole dose. It's been months and that's as far as I've gotten. I don't know how long it will take me to finally get off of it. But I want off. Even at half a dose I have more energy than I have in the last five years combined. I feel like I belong as a participant rather than a bedside observer!

column1: 2614$Bipolar Depression$10/6/2014 10:33:18 PM$Reviewer: rdnkgrl
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$3$5$"After OD-ing in a suicide attempt a month ago
column3: I was put on 50mg Seroquel XR in the morning and 200mg at night
column4: which was quickly increased to 400mg at night.  This med works great for the intended purpose...helps control my moods
column5: helps me sleep better
column6: I'm not suicidal anymore
column7: and I find myself having more energy.  What I do not like
column8: however
column9: it that it has caused major weight gain! I have gone from weighing an acceptable (my opinion!) 120lbs to an absolutely horrible 140 lbs in a matter of one short month!!  I am only 5'4""
column10: and although the medicine is definitely working for what it is supposed to
column11: I find that I am getting depressed again over the weight gain issue
column12: therefore cancelling out the benefits of the drug.  I have decided
column13: after weighing myself today in the store at 142 lbs
column14: that I have to stop talking this drug.  It will not do me any good if I keep gaining weight because I am becoming more depressed
column16: because I consider myself fat and can't loose weight and I am hating myself.  For me the drug is not worth the side effects.  For someone who is not concerned about their weight it could be a miracle drug!"

column1: 2618$Bipolar Depression$8/5/2014 4:40:10 AM$Reviewer: 25-34 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$3$"I have been taking Seroquel nightly for 2+ years.
PROS: I sleep much better
column2: my mood is more stable
column3: and I rarely enter into manic periods. I am almost a functioning human being again.

column1: CONS: (1) I feel groggy for about 12-13 hours after taking any dose (25-150 mgs)
column2: which makes mornings feel nearly impossible
column3: and has caused me to miss several important appointments. (2) About an hour after taking Seroquel I ALWAYS get insane munchies
column4: worse than anything I ever felt smoking/ingesting pot
column5: and then I get very drowsy. MIDNIGHT MUNCHIES + 12 HOURS SLEEP x SEVERAL MONTHS = SUBSTANTIAL WEIGHT GAIN. (3) If I don't take my Seroquel
column6: I don't sleep
column7: and over time I have developed a tolerance for Seroquel
column8: so I have to take increased quantities for it to be effective. (4) Recently my blood tests indicated that my liver is damaged
column9: and my new doctor wants to start hunting around for alternatives to Seroquel
column10: but I am reluctant."

column1: 2621$Bipolar Depression$6/11/2014 3:52:47 PM$Reviewer: dmakower
column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$1$5$I have been on Seroquel XR for 7 years.  I have taken as much as 600 mg.
column3: for depression and manic episodes.  It saved my life as I was suicidally depressed.  It went away really quick.  I went from weighing 160 to almost 300 lbs.  I could barely walk one house.  After having cataract surgery in both eyes
column4: developing sugar diabetes
column5: and so sleepy day and night
column6: I changed my diet am walking 1 mile a day
column7: and after two years have lost 150 lbs.  I can only eat around 1000 calories a day and was only eating 800 calories a day to begin weight loss.  If I eat bread I can gain 3-4 lbs in a day.  I am glad I'm not been depressed for a very long time
column8: but can't stand the day time sleepiness.  My doctor has gradually gotten down to 150 mg. and am still as sleepy as can be.  The trade offs have been worth it up until now
column9: but I am sick and tired of being sick and tired.  Don't know how low I can go and still get the good affects of keeping my moods stable.

column1: 2630$Bipolar Depression$3/25/2014 7:31:13 PM$Reviewer: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $1$1$1$"I was put on this drug before Thanksgiving of 2013. column2: I soon found that I was sleeping all of the time and my mood just got worse. I was a straight A student who always paid attention in class and I turned into a student who rarely went to school and was always sleeping. I began to have horrible nightmares that I would sometimes wake up panting and terrified. I'm normally a hard worker but on this medicine I was disinterested in everything that came up. My health greatly declined while on this medicine both physically and mentally. When I couldn't take my medicine for a week after leaving it at an aunts
column3: with in a few days I was a wake and alert and much happier. The only thing that happened was I was extremely itchy. I was on a high dose from the beginning but I don't think being on a small one would do anything to help. I am now three weeks off this medicine and I feel amazing and able to handle everything going on."

column2: now I am at least 20 pounds over weight.  And since I am not manic as much
column3: I have a less desire to do anything 'fun' and I feel lazy.  But the trade off is worth it.  I got in alittle trouble when I was manic.  Now Im just boring.  Boring and fat.  But not 'crazy'

column1:
2653$Bipolar Depression$1/28/2013 9:03:42 AM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $1$1$1$I took Seroquel for 9 months & I HATED it.  I worked up to 300mg.  I took the medication at night & it would knock me out for 10 – 12 hours straight.  I gave it a couple months to see if the side effects would lessen.  They didn’t.  So we cut my dosage in half down to 150mg.  I still slept a lot & I could not get moving the next day.  I kept taking the meds thinking things would level out over the next few months.  They didn’t.  The medication did not help my depression at all & on top of that my body felt so drugged.  I was so weak that I could barely take care of every day household chores.  I almost never left my house because I always felt so bad both emotionally & physically.  We cut my dosage down again & a couple months later I still felt horrible.  I WAS A PRISONER IN MY OWN BODY!!  I read that other people gained weight on this medication.  I actually LOST weight.  I have always been thin but while on this medication I started to look like a walking skeleton.  I live alone & I was too weak & tried to even get up to cook.  I was only eating one small meal a day.  It was quite scary watching myself literally withering away.  I finally asked my doctor to get me off Seroquel.  She prescribed Citalopram (generic for Lexapro) and after just two weeks I am starting to feel better & I am eating better also.  I regret wasting almost a year of my life on Seroquel.  I should have gotten off of it sooner.  Live & learn.
2654$Bipolar Depression$1/20/2013 8:00:48 AM$Reviewer: lost, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$5$I was feeling really bad a couple of years ago. I have a history of manic-depression and I was on the depressive side. Seroquel xr worked extremely well and had me functioning again. My Dr. was knowledgable and supportive which played a key role in my well being.

After 2 or 3 years I began feeling disillusioned about life. I had gained some extra 80 pounds. I didn't really expect this but it probably was worth it because it saved my life. The Dr. gave this drug as an alternative from what I had been taking. Believe me if you don't need the drugs you're better off living a healthy lifestyle. Growing up in the era of drugs and alcohol I did my share and attribute this to my life."

column1: 2763$Bipolar Depression$12/29/2010 8:27:02 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $3$3$4$"Well.. I started taking seroquel at the tender age of 13 after a series of medication trials and failures. It has at the very least kept me from going off the deep end.. I do know that when I haven't been able to afford the $478 (and rising all the time) for a 30 day supply of 150mg daily I feel the effects of not having it- i get depressed
column2: cannot focus at all
column3: angry at everything
column4: fidgety
column5: restless- cannot sleep at night at all. When I'm on it I mostly feel foggy
column6: my memory has declined significantly since taking it (no other reason sticks out as to why). It has contributed to many small failures in my professional life
column7: but I know I wouldn't be alive to hold a job without SOME meds. I take in conjunction with Wellbutrin- it has been a good combo for me
column8: but no cure all. I've had weight gain
column9: tremors
column10: constant constipation.. I cannot keep focused enough to finish sentences in many cases and it's extremely embarrassing to look like a fool like that. I would recommend this medication to those who haven't and need to try something because it's been better than nothing and it has generally contributed to a better quality of life for me. Now if only I could rid myself of the life sentence that is bipolar disorder. I really worry about the long term effects (diabetes is probably not fun)."

column4: scary visual and auditory hallucinations
column5: nightmares
column6: significant weight gain
column7: increase in mammary size
column8: and anti-social tendencies. Before you freak out about my credibility
column9: prior to becoming bipolar
column10: I was a practicing psychologist
column11: family therapist
column12: a university professor
column13: (Psych) and socially well-adjusted. I am also taking
column14: Wellbutrin
column17: and Temazapan. In the last two weeks
column19: and quit Seroquel. The hallucinations have stopped
column20: the voices have stopped and I feel more at ease. The medical model of mental health is really a no-win situation. One brief example that reminded me of the frustration of long-term self-medication; I had a bone spur on my elbow and waited 2 months before seeing my family doctor
column21: I didn't want to take any additional medication. Well
column22: I had it bass-ackwards. After 3 DAYS! on Diclofenac
column24: my elbow stopped hurting. After 3 YEARS on the aforementioned meds
column25: I still get depressed. All the literature states that these meds will restore the ""deficiency"" of neurotransmitters and encourages you to keep on taking them. Well
column26: where's the cure? Look at the  list to the left
column27: there's 25 meds for depression. How did the neurotransmitters become depleted
column28: that's my question. I am beginning to realize that being depressed is depressing. Maybe we should allow ourselves to feel anxiety in manageable doses and work through it
column29: instead of sedating our more painful emotions. That's what I'm going to try. Wish me luck. Peace. MK-ULTRA"

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$4$1$"I am bipolar type II; my most destructive symptom is depression. 800 mg is my dose and it works wonderfully - note that 400 mg was NOT a theraputic dose for me
column3: and it was only by overdosing one night (I was at the time very depressed) that I discovered a higher dose made me feel better. I am fully functional thanks to this medicine: attending work
column4: spending time with friends and family
column5: maintaining a healthy romantic relationship
column6: and volunteering in my community. That said: this drug is NOT for everyone
column7: and you should try drugs like Zoloft
column8: Lexapro
column9: Effexor etc before you try this drug because the side-effects can be horrible. My side effects are dry-mouth
column10: severe drowsiness and akathesia
column11: a painful panic=like attack that can cause me to walk around my apartment in circles for an hour or two after I take the drug. Luckily
column12: my doctor and I found Mirapex
column13: an anti-Parkinson's drug
column14: to stop these panic episodes from occurring. I take a significant dose of Mirapex before bed
column16: and also usually smoke a small amount of marijuana
column17: and this has allowed me to enjoy the benefits of Seroquel without the horrible panic. If you have akathesia as a side-effect
column18: and the drug is helping you
column19: please try Mirapex before you give up!

column1: Finally
column2: please note that every story in this thread is one person's personal experience - including mine! - and none of these stories are an accurate portrayal of what you will experience yourself if you try this drug. I mean this as both a warning and an encouragement; only you and your doctor can decide if this drug is right for you
column3: and I hope our stories make you more informed in this decision. God bless."

column1: 1393$Bipolar Disorder in Remission$11/6/2009 6:43:29 PM$Reviewer: Sue
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$This has been the most effective drug I have taken for  bipolar disorder.  It does cause nighttime munchies and dry mouth but otherwise I feel great.  I don't feel groggy but I think that is because of the degree of mania I was dealing with.  I have read other reviews and people need to know there are alternatives available. If you are experiencing terrible side effects you need to try a different drug or combination of drugs. Most of us have to endure being a guinea pig until the right balance of meds is found.  Hang in there & you will get your life back.

2473$Bipolar Disorder in Remission$11/19/2007 8:28:35 PM$Reviewer: AliveAtLast!!, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$Following my Psychiatrist’s advice
column2: I started with a beginning dose of 25mg per day and ramped up to 600mg per day within 2 weeks.  I have currently been on 600mg for about 13 months.  I went from being a hopeless 30+ year alcoholic (apparently self medicating bi-polar II)
column3: with frequent in-patient treatments
column4: to a recovering alcoholic sober for over a year now.  I have no doubt that Seroquel saved my life.  I went from the brink of suicide to the most ""together"" I've felt in my 53 years.  The only thing different with my alcoholic treatment strategy this time was the Seroquel.  I've noticed a couple of posts saying Seroquel has some ""street value"" for drug abuse.  Hmmm....I would think that is the case only if you wanted to SLEEP on the street.  This stuff puts you in snooze mode
column5: so take it before bed.  I have noticed absolutely no surreal or “feeling high” characteristics.  It does give you hunger fits
column6: so you need to religiously follow Doctor's instructions and get regular blood work to test glucose levels
column7: cholesterol and triglycerides.  You also need to work a responsible weight maintenance program.  Not too hard to do when your head is screwed on straight like Seroquel has done for me.  My anxiety level went from an extremely high level to what I perceive as low.  The world is now a pretty good place to live.  I should note that I am also on 325mg Effexor XR (SSRI) per day (past 5 years) and have no idea if the combination has somehow given me outstanding results. All I can say is Seroquel RULES for me.  Your mileage may vary."

) people take for granted. I was suffering within myself and no one understood me. Many people don't know what it's like hearing voices
column2: seeing things that aren't there and having mood swings beyond my control. With this medication I go my life back. I was able to get my bachelors degree and work in the medical field. I have to say that this medication along with my Celexa has definately changed my life for the better! I have had no side effects. I have tried many different medications given by my doctor throughout my jouney with this illness. This medication is the best by far and I really think that it has changed my life for the better."

column1: 221$Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed$2/5/2016 5:51:29 PM$Reviewer: Aquis
column2: 45-54 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$4$4$"My experience is overall favorable but I do experience bothersome side-effects but they are manageable because I take my meds at bedtime so I'm asleep when my blood levels are highest which is when you are most likely to have side-effects. Good- it calms me down when I feel agitated and my thoughts race. At higher dosages it helps with depression. I need it to help me fall asleep and stay asleep for 6-8 hrs. Not so good- I have to be in bed within 15 minutes of taking b/c I start to feel ""spacey"" and eventually dizzy. Unfortunately
column3: if I wake up to go to the bathroom or get something to drink (it makes me thirsty sometimes) then I'm in trouble b/c I'm disoriented and lightheaded. If I get up too quickly from bed
column4: I become very dizzy and have problems breathing like I can't get enough oxygen. I have accidentally walked into walls or lost in my closet. It's concerning that's how my brain reacts on Seroquel. It has negatively affected my libido and I can't orgasm after 15 minutes of taking it. I would have a very difficult time if I had to take it during the day and definitely would have to stop it because of dizziness and blunt affect (aka ""zombified""). But because I take it at bedtime it's ok. I don't want to take an antipsychotic but that's just the way it is right now. I am more med-compliant with my psychiatrist now that I taking Seroquel."

column1: 574$Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed$4/3/2012 12:44:58 AM$Reviewer: Philos64, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$4$2$What I've learned from 8+ years of taking Seroquel:
1. Gaining weight was a problem in the past
column2: however it is not now. Exercising
column3: eating lousy (yes
column4: lousy)
column5: and taking supplements to help with the vitamin deficiencies have helped me over the years. My definition of eating lousy is: Ice Cream with lots of peanuts on top. At least once a day. I use protein shakes and mix in good things to make up for the loss of the most vital nutriants. I don't eat junk food
column6: or drink soda. I drink iced tea and water. I've found that no calorie sweetners increase my anxiety. To help with constipation
column7: I take an Acidopholus based supplement. Btw
column8: I am NOT endorsing my methods of eating!

column1: 2. Seroquel makes me ""eat walk"". Definition: 1/2-3/4 hour after taking my Seroquel
column2: I get hungry
column3: so I head for the kitchen and get something to eat. Unfortunately
column4: eating kicks in my Seroquel
column5: causing me to stumble about in the kitchen
column6: and frequently falling. I have slept quite a few nights on the kitchen floor due to this. A friend of mine who witnessed this
column7: told me I was like a kid who didn't want to go to bed at night.

column1: My answer to this has been to take a snack with me to bed. Because of this
column2: I have many nightgowns with chocolate stains on them!

column1: A Seroquel friend of mine was the one who asked me if I had noticed that Seroquel kicks it in much more quickly after eating.
3. Know your dose. If you're on the hypomanic side of bp
column2: talk to your pdoc if adjusting the dosage is right for you. I have found that Seroquel does not help with my depression
column3: so my pdoc adjusts my dosage accordingly. I am atypical
column4: so my dosage needs are normally higher than most others.

column1: 4. Don't give up the benefits of Seroquel because of the potential weight gain. Most of us know that finding a med that finally works can be really tough
column2: and side effects come along with the package. There are so many different ways to stay active and get rid of any weight gain you might come across.

column1: If I can do make it
column2: You can too!"

column1: 596$Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed$2/22/2012 3:11:55 AM$Reviewer: Jenntonic1
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$"I attempted suicide 2 months ago & landed in the hospital. (Honestly it was a blessing in disguise.) I had bouts of mania & depression on & off for over 18yrs untreated. At times I thought that there was nothing wrong with me & everyone else was the problem. During my 20's I experienced feelings of being immortal
column3: invincible & on top of the world. I became a risk taker. All of these actions felt normal to me. I drank alcohol
column4: used drugs
column5: spent money without a care & later have buyers remorse or overwhelming feelings of guilt. Several times a year I would feel depressed & have thoughts of suicide but honestly never thought I would actually attempt it. Deep down I knew there was some type of chemical imbalance with the ups & down. Later I realized my actions greatly affected those around me. When I would start to feel mania or ""normal""
column6: I would forget about needing help & think everything was ok. Never once did I consider that I may have a mental illness. When I turned 30
column7: I started having lower back pain that is now chronic. 3 years ago I also found out that I have arthritis and fibromyalgia & that these too are chronic. I tried a few antidepressants & pain management
column8: none that really worked. I withdrew from life
column9: stayed in bed & isolated myself
column10: I became agitated
column11: anxious & my stress level was through the roof. My relationship of 11 years became rocky & my partner left. Now
column12: at 38yrs everything finally crashed together. So I tried to take my life.(I'm happy that didn't work out!) I was soon diagnosed with Bipolar I disorder during my hospital stay. My psychiatrist started me on a better pain regimen that works plus a low dose of Seroquel 50mg then up to only 100mg. My pain
column13: mood & depression are more manageable & my relationship is back. I've combined that with therapy & proper rest. I'm back in my life and doing what I need to stay balanced. I have much work to do & may need to up my dose later. It's amazing how this med has evened me enough to enjoy life again."

I have always suffered from what I thought was severe mania and I would work with my doctor and he let me adjust my meds accordingly. I don't drink alcohol OR do drugs that is a huge factor in the seroquel working for me! I was on very  high dose's of seroquel It was my decision not my doctors because of the delusions prior to me taking seroquel were very scary to me! It was like I was trapped in another world and I wasn't having fun! I  was on an average 300 mil of seroquel every night but at some points 600mil.  I was at the same job for 8 years and didn't even know they (my co workers) were stressing me out to the point I had to take such high doses. Well I was fired from that job and 3 months later I'm down to 100 mill a night and I have NEVER been happier! I'm a hair dresser and my clients all can tell I'm a different person!!! I've started losing weight 10 pounds since my dosages have changed. (  I lowered my meds  VERY SLOWLY
column3: otherwise you could spiral into depression) It really helps if you know the signs of your symptons. Which I was in denial because I was always happy (or so I thought) I didn't agree with the depression symptoms the internet told me I was having. But I now know it was the truth. I would have lowered my meds ALOT SOONER
column4: IF I realized I wasn't as manic as I thought. I'm not sure if anyone else read before about when depressed we stop taking showers
column5: Well I was only taking showers once a week
column6: for time sakes or I'd be late for work! No one ever knew! I didn't smell or try to cover it up with perfume! Of course I never went to the gym so I was never sweaty and all gross! Well I hoped this has helped someone

column1:
1127$Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed$5/17/2010 3:36:41 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$4$Have been on Lamictal about 8 years, added Seroquel about 2 years ago and have never been more stable emotionally--I have a good job and good relationships and I haven't had an episode in 2 years since I've been on it--and bipolar does not control me anymore.  Good combo of drugs.  However, Seroquel's side effects are considerable.  They are manageable, but you have to put in some effort--get blood tests to check your thyroid and cholesterol and fats, eat really healthy and work out or you will gain weight, schedule your days so you can always get 9-10 hours of sleep even if you have to go to bed by 8pm.  The heart palpitations don't hit me if I stay in bed once I take it--the palpitations only show up if I try to fight through the drowsiness to move around, so I just plan to be in bed for 10 hours.  It's a question of what you're willing to put up with to be stable emotionally.  Bipolar made my life hell, as long as I could remember, and for the first time, I've been stable for more than a few weeks at a time.  2 good years and counting.

column1: 1262$Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed$2/18/2010 5:14:37 PM$Reviewer: terry
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$5$I have been on this medication for four years and it has controlled the impulsive behaviors associated with the mania.  That in itself has been a god send.  Being able to sleep after years of insomnia is amazing.  I am concerned about the weight gain.  Has been approx. 30 lbs over the four years.  I have a wonderful man in my life who thinks I am still beautiful
column3: very important!!!  I worry about the blood sugar but so far so good.  I go to sleep about an hour after taking but have found a schedule that works for me.  Won't babysit my 2 yr old grandson overnight because I can't guarantee I would wake up if he did.  Getting up in the morning has become a little more difficult so will need to adust for that.  Just have to find what works for you!  I know this drug isn't for everyone
column4: that's for sure.

column1: 1664$Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed$5/8/2009 3:09:10 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $3$1$4$"I started this medication when I was first diagnosed with Bipolar Disorder 4 years ago.
I tried to make it work
column2: but I started to notice several things. First I started falling when I got out of bed. Then I could not catch myself with my arms. Then a few days later I started having tremors and my head would shake like Parkinson's. One day my boss told me he was concerned because I have forgotten things that I have done normally for years. I went to a neurologist and he said that my left side of my body was unstable.

column1: After talking with my doctor
column2: he recommended that I switch to Lamictal. Lamictal has been a life saver for me.. that is when I started to truly heal and be able to make decisions. I would say that if you are having symptoms that are worry some and scare you
column3: please talk to you counselors and therapist. You have to find the right combination when you have this disorder.

column1: thanks
nicole

column3: but i get through it and im fine an hour or two later. this medication is great as a sedative. as a college student also with extreme ADHD i struggle quite a bit to try and maintain an A average
column4: and seroquel has really helped me from completely loosing it when i feel overwhelmed or frustrated. i no longer walk out of classes crying due to stress or bite my teachers face off. im normally not one to do this. in fact i cant stand disrespectful students. i have had VERY good teachers
column5: but the bad one are such a trigger for my mania. i take an extra amount before attending their classes."

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"Seroquel XR as a PRN medication for me together with the combination of 2 other medications (Depakote ER and a once-a-month intramuscular injection: Invega Sustenna) have done wonders for the control of the Bipolar I Disorder mental issue that I have. For years I've struggled with not getting enough sleep at one time period. My extremes of mood swings are ever so much lighter and the manic and depressive phases likewise more controlled.

column1: As in all cases one medication may not work as well for one person as another and maybe not the same dosage either or combination of meds. There are differing dosages of Seroquel XR that may be needed to adjust the amount. I have found out throughout the years that if I could get the proper amount of sleep
column2: most of the time
column3: I wouldn't have a situation whereby I needed to be hospitalized. I've lost count as to the nummber of times hospitalized.

column1: As with all medications it takes time(usually 2 t0 3wks.) to realize if a medication will be successful and most the time there will also be side effects and some are only temporary. I highly recommend that a person not self-medicate with illicit drugs. Watch out for triggers that will sabotage your well-being. As always if possible have a mental health professional guide you through your journey dealing mental hygiene. Do not give up!
May God Bless!  "

column5: I take 300 mgs at night.

column3: severe muscle twitches and cramps

It's very hard to function after taking it. My heart races. And it makes me VERY hungry when it kicks in. It also makes it hard to communicate as well. If someone asks me something after taking it im very incoherent. I also don't remember things that I did while it's in my system. Like if someone calls you on your phone you answer it because of habit. But I can't really remember the phone call. My memory isn't the best either. I believe this med is the cause of it. In my opinion the side effects to me are not as important as how I feel and moods are a lot better. The side effects that i mentioned I have had for a long time. I have been on this medication now for 3 years. "

column2: however

Hopefully my GP can find something more suited."
46$Manic-Depression$10/10/2014 1:32:07 PM$Reviewer: Wendy
column2: 35-44 Female  (Patient) $5$5$5$"I've been taking Seroquel for 6 months & it has been as vital as a heart pill or any other that helps you maintain a healthy life. There are side-effects
column3: and some are not pleasant but I find that the benefits have greatly outweighed any negatives. In the beginning
column4: I was often tired and had a hard time waking up in the morning
column5: but that has evened out over the months. I also had an initial weight gain of 10 pounds
column6: mostly caused by the Seroquel “munchies” as I call them. And that has also leveled off. You do need to pay closer attention to your diet on it. There is also a strange reaction where you want to move your limbs while you are resting. I found that decreasing my dose some helped with that.

column1: Now the positives: I have never slept better. I used to wake up multiple times during the night and had a difficult time falling to sleep. I now get at least 8 hours of the night and wake up feeling calm and relaxed. And it is a deep
column2: restful sleep. It does not feel artificial or leave me with a medicinal hangover. Sleep has done wonders for my health. I no longer have bad headaches or muscle cramps throughout the day. I rarely have to take ibuprophen (which I used to take almost daily). No more self-medicating with alcohol or alcohol cravings.But the best and most significant difference is that I have finally found my calm! I can be happy
column3: satisfied and content with little things. It's also made me more patient with others. I now know the meaning of peace of mind. It’s no longer me against the world looking for the enemy in everyone I meet. I feel at ease when I wake up and actually enjoy my morning coffee
column4: watching tv
column5: and reading without interruptions from intrusive thoughts.I no longer lash out at my husband or scream at my kids. My compulsions for self-destructive behavior have melted away kind of like a demon leaving my body. I cannot tell you what a huge relief that is. Everything is lighter without the weight of your own guilt and shame. It gave me my life back"

column1: 59$Manic-Depression$1/22/2014 3:36:47 PM$Reviewer: predisposed
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $3$2$4$"An effective downer for the mania-prone
column3: no question. But no one's kidding about the side effects practically rivaling the problems for which you're taking it (which makes me wonder how the first-gens could have possibly been worse
column4: but that's what I hear.)
column5: and withdrawing from this one's worse than usual.

column1: The most severe problem when trying to come off this once it becomes intolerable is the unbelievable nausea that comes on within a couple days if your tapering rate is off
column2: and is comparable to drinking way too much. It is not pleasant
column3: to put it mildly. When I withdrew too quickly
column4: the nausea was all-encompassing and even basic finger-movements were like short free-falls.

column1: Don't screw around with this stuff
column2: it punishes you hardcore if you stop taking it or taper off too quickly.

column1: I'd recommend this for periods of mania
column2: but not when you don't need it for that. It caused me to be listless
column3: apathetic
column4: and like pretty much all antipsychotics I've tried (though nowhere near to the same extent as the sadistic side effects of Zyprexa)
column5: causes what is commonly termed ""brain fog""
column6: which makes you feel
column7: well
column8: drugged. In my case
column9: it was so bad that I would not accept it. I'm still trying to taper off it
column10: but nothing's been more unpleasant than quetiapine in this regard.

column1: It's still vastly superior to Risperdal and definitely Zyprexa
column2: and probably some other antipsychotics that were so disorienting I literally could not remember long periods of time while being on them. But it's the best of the worst
column3: as it is. Take with extreme caution
column4: and be wary of taking it for long. Its one saving grace is that it works fast and knocks out mania (along with you) almost immediately
column5: so use it for that."

column1: 246$Manic-Depression$5/20/2015 12:47:36 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$3$I have been on Seroquel 300mg XR 2x/day for over 2 years now and I have found that it significantly helps with my bipolar disorder. column5: for anyone starting out on this med

column7: it will work.

column1: 283$Manic-Depression$10/10/2014 1:29:02 PM$Reviewer: Wendy
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$5$5$"I've been taking Seroquel for 6 months & it has been as vital as a heart pill or any other that helps you maintain a healthy life. There are side-effects
column3: and some are not pleasant but I find that the benefits have greatly outweighed any negatives. In the beginning
column4: I was often tired and had a hard time waking up in the morning
column5: but that has evened out over the months. I also had an initial weight gain of 10 pounds
column6: mostly caused by the Seroquel “munchies” as I call them. And that has also leveled off. You do need to pay closer attention to your diet on it. There is also a strange reaction where you want to move your limbs while you are resting. I found that decreasing my dose some helped with that.

column1: Now the positives: I have never slept better. I used to wake up multiple times during the night and had a difficult time falling to sleep. I now get at least 8 hours of the night and wake up feeling calm and relaxed. And it is a deep
column2: restful sleep. It does not feel artificial or leave me with a medicinal hangover. Sleep has done wonders for my health. I no longer have bad headaches or muscle cramps throughout the day. I rarely have to take ibuprophen (which I used to take almost daily). No more self-medicating with alcohol or alcohol cravings.But the best and most significant difference is that I have finally found my calm! I can be happy
column3: satisfied and content with little things. It's also made me more patient with others. I now know the meaning of peace of mind. It’s no longer me against the world looking for the enemy in everyone I meet. I feel at ease when I wake up and actually enjoy my morning coffee
column4: watching tv
column5: and reading without interruptions from intrusive thoughts.I no longer lash out at my husband or scream at my kids. My compulsions for self-destructive behavior have melted away kind of like a demon leaving my body. I cannot tell you what a huge relief that is. Everything is lighter without the weight of your own guilt and shame. It gave me my life back"

757$Manic-Depression$7/18/2011 6:28:40 PM$Reviewer: it's me!, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $1$1$3$Worst drug in the world! After 2 yrs of feeling like a depressed, fat, anesthised, drugged out, zombie, I weaned myself off this medicine. It's been over 3 years and have I never felt better. I lost 60 pounds in the first 6 months and started living life again. I was misdiagnosed in my early 20's as manic-depressive and was prescribed every type of psych drug a person can take. I found a new psych who listened and helped me gradually wean off all of the meds. I no longer take any psych meds at all. I finally feel like my self again! Seroquel caused me to gain a lot of weight, dried out my nose, gave me headaches, caused severe dry mouth and tooth decay, restless leg syndrome, muscle and tendon problems, confusion, grogginess, craved sweets, rebound insomnia, agitation, irritability, clumsiness, blurred vision, racing heart beat, and a overall decline in my health.

column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$2$5$"       I have Bipolar 1 and I am 16 years old.  I was diagnosed February my freshmen year of high school and they put me on Lamictal in June.  It treated some of my symptoms in the first month: extreme interest in sex
column3: delusional thinking
column4: depression
column5: and others I can't even remember because they stopped.  But I added Seroquel last May (October now).  Stress and bad sleeping patterns set me off
column6: and I am pretty good about recognizing when I am about to go through an episode or what state I am in.

column1: I take a dose of 150 Lamictal (2x a day)
column2: 200 Seroquel (2x day).  I was a little out of shape when I started Seroquel
column3: so its side effects were strong
column4: especially dizziness (I would sit down for a long time and when I got up
column5: I lost my balance
column6: couldn’t see because my vision would go white.  And I usually fell down or smacked into a wall
column7: not fun…).  I don’t like the dizziness and this started the day after I began taking it.  Being in good physical shape can really help.   Seroquel also causes me to have episodes that I call panic attacks that started when I increased it.

column1: A trypical “panic attack”:  I have trouble thinking and functioning mentally.  I’m a vegetable.  And when I am trying to do a certain thing
column2: like math
column3: it frustrates me and then I loose it.  I start to cry
column4: my breathing gets messed up
column5: and I can’t put 2 and 2 together to save my life.  Someone will try to ask me a question and instead of answering
column6: I start crying and breathing fast
column7: my heart-rate skyrockets
column8: I repeat phrases like “I don’t know” because I can’t think and I’m completely terrified.  This is set off by stress and a change in sleeping patterns.

column1: I’m not sure if Seroquel is a good thing even though my doctor thinks it is.  But even though my doctor disagrees
column2: I can honestly pinpoint some bad things to this medication.  If it works for you
column3: great
column4: if it doesn’t
column5: we might have something in common."

column1: 2018$Manic-Depression$10/8/2008 9:42:14 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$2$5$I don't know how people can take over 150mg of this medication. I cut 150mg tablets in half
column2: and I feel like a zombie the next morning. The medicine is very effective. At times

column1: 2351$Manic-Depression$2/3/2008 8:47:41 PM$Reviewer: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$4$5$"i have been taking this for 1 &1/2 years.I also take effexor.I divide my life in 2
column2: pre and after this med. My life has changed so dramatically
column3: in a good way!I can process info
column4: am not in a state of panic and self loathing
column5: and confusion.Now that my thinking has cleared up
column6: i must face the crazy things i did in the past
column7: and the troubles i have had all my life
column8: it is very difficult and sad.My illness ran my life before
column9: not me.I am grateful that i can now stand back and really think about things
column10: big or small
column11: the medicine allows me to have the luxury that""normal"" people have all the time.I am 55 and for the first time in my life i get to hear the words in songs I've heard for 50 years
column12: so simple yet a profoundly different experience
column13: as i was never able to comprehend even such basic stuff before.The ""psychotic"" stuff has slowed down too. It's great to be able to sleep every night.I tried easing up on the effexor
column14: but immediately had the constant body pains that i had all my life
column15: so the combo is what works.I no longer have  my physical
column16: emotional and mental life filled with confusion and pain.Weight gain has been the biggest problem
column19: and receding gums concern me.Also a series of skin infections on my feet continuously.I sometimes have bad heartburn
column20: but perhaps this is also due to weight gain.I am rarely sick
column21: have fewer colds or headaches than before.I cannot take the summer heat
column22: and find that sweating comes with any physical exertion at all.I am concerned about raised sugar levels
column23: I seem to crave sweets.I also am thirsty a lot.And finally
column24: the price is outrageous-$760 for one of the seoquel prescriptions. My health ins. does not pay for scripts
column25: but was the only ins.I could find that covered mental health.My health ins. is my biggest monthly expense
column26: more than house etc.It is clearly discriminatory for those of us needing meds and mental health coverage.Despite the side effects
column27: I cannot imagine living without it."

column4: I would recommend Seroquel as an alternative to Zyprexa for anybody. The side effects are a bit similar

column1: 2833$Manic-Depression$1/25/2010 8:23:27 PM$Reviewer: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$4$5$I can finally sleep! Keeps me asleep 6-8hrs.300mg xr. Also visual hallucinations rare.

column2: then tried seroquel...  Worked fro several yrs....  ive gotten much better
column3: through therapy and a better life style change...  gained 10-15 lbs on it also... def couldnt get motivated at all
